issue.title: ignition-gazebo binaries conflict with ignition-gazebo2 binaries

content.raw:
If we want to handle this as upstream in our applications (instead of just remove the symlinks and leave the versioned commands) I think that Louise suggestion would be the way to go: add some logic to unversioned commands transforming them from symlinks to scripts that handle which version to call.

In Linux distributions the downstream work usually handle different versions using a system-wise mechanism. In Debian/Ubuntu systems we have the [alternatives](https://wiki.debian.org/DebianAlternatives) approach that allows the user to list, change, add or delete commands that can be implemented by different programs or different versions (like gcc, sendmail, ...).
